events.title: Death of Emperor Nero
events.description: Roman Emperor Nero died by suicide, ending the Julio-Claudian dynasty and initiating the Year of the Four Emperors.
events.significance: Marked a turning point in Roman history with a period of civil war and instability.

events.title: Jacques Cartier's First Voyage
events.description: French explorer Jacques Cartier embarked on his first voyage to the Gulf of Saint Lawrence, laying the foundation for French claims in North America.
events.significance: Significant for the expansion of European exploration and eventual colonization of Canada.

events.title: George V Marries Mary of Teck
events.description: Prince George, later King George V, married Mary of Teck, who would become Queen Consort of the United Kingdom.
events.significance: Their reign would oversee significant events including World War I and changes in the British Empire.

events.title: Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia Arrested
events.description: Prominent Indian freedom fighter Dr. Ram Manohar Lohia was arrested by British authorities during the independence movement.
events.significance: Symbolizes the ongoing struggle for Indian independence from British rule during the mid-20th century.

events.title: Sweeping Watergate Hearings Begin
events.description: The Senate Watergate Committee started televised hearings, exposing President Nixon's administration's involvement in the Watergate scandal.
events.significance: Played a central role in uncovering political corruption that led to the resignation of President Nixon.
